meanings.definition: A person who cherishes or pursues high or noble principles, purposes, goals, etc.
meanings.sent1: Many idealists believe in making the world a better place through kindness and compassion.
meanings.sent2: The group of idealists worked together to create a community garden for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent3: The idealists decided to start a lemonade stand to raise money for charity, but ended up giving away all the lemonade for free!
meanings.sent4: She was like an idealist in a world of cynics, always seeing the good in people even when others couldn't.
meanings.sent5: The image of the idealists planting trees in the barren land stayed in everyone's minds for years to come.

meanings.sent1: The young idealists dreamed of building a floating city in the sky one day.
meanings.sent2: Although considered an idealist by many, his innovative ideas often led to groundbreaking inventions.
meanings.sent3: The idealists thought they could power the entire town with just windmills made of recycled materials.
meanings.sent4: In a world of realists, she stood out like an idealist painting in a gallery of photographs.
meanings.sent5: The image of the idealists trying to build a time machine out of cardboard and duct tape was both amusing and endearing.
